sn13.6:1.2: “Mendicants, suppose the great earth was worn away and eroded except for seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds.
sn13.6:1.4: Which is more: the great earth that has been worn away and eroded, or the seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds that are left?”
sn13.6:2.1: “Sir, the great earth that has been worn away and eroded is certainly more.
sn13.6:2.2: The seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds are tiny.
sn13.6:2.3: Compared to the great earth that has been worn away and eroded, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part.”
sn13.6:2.4: “In the same way, for a noble disciple, the suffering that’s over and done with is more …”
